pros: Benefits Vacation Sick time Friendly environment Easy work

review_title: Feels like home but low pay compared to other universities
pros: Feels like home, lots of time off, flexible work schedule. Freedom to structure classes however we see fit. I don’t know about other departments, but the department in which I work is amazing. Great department head and admin staff, excellent faculty, great students. The dean of our college is fantastic!
cons: Required to teach too many hours and the pay is low compared to other universities. Pays instructors with Ph.D.s the same wage as those with just a master’s degree.

review_title: Low pay, long hours, minimal benefits, technology is lacking.
pros: Beautiful campus Good colleagues Freedom in lesson planning
cons: No work/life balance. Extremely low pay. Extra service hours are required outside of teaching full-time. No opportunities for advancement.

review_title: Southeastern's landscape of hurricane resistant live oaks never gets old.
job_title: Graduate Assistant Tutor in Hammond, LA
pros: If you ever thought about going to graduate school for English, and like me, creative writing, this is the university. The graduate programs offer part time jobs in the department and in return you get paid and het to got to graduate school. The 'getting into' a school program like this will be the tough part. The teachers want us to succeed, and at the same time, they are tough on us about the level of writing they expect in our research papers. I've learned how to be a much better writer because of it. I think this program is going to launch me into a much higher pay bracket than before, and into the next phase of life.
cons: It gets really hot in the summertime. Better find a friend with a pool or lives near a river.

pros: You have a lot of freedom to do whatever you want and are able to determine how you want to teach your classes.
cons: Expectations were often unclear and did not inspire confidence.

pros: I work as a Software Developer Intern at the English department of Southeastern Louisiana University. Good Work-Environment. You won't feel left out. Teamwork is the key!
cons: I do not think there are any cons to mention.

review_title: Many employees have left and I'll be leaving too unless something changes!
pros: Good people, good benefits, great holiday closures
cons: Pay is not good. Thought I'd be here for years to come, but I'm looking to leave because the University President is violating Civil Rights Title VII laws. University has lost and will continue to loose good employees because of recent unconstitutional policy.

pros:
First, if you work in the computer lab, the possibility of drama drops 1%.

- You will be able to study
- the boss is more than willing to work around your classes
-the coworkers are more than willing to help you out if you are new(and boy was I..oy)

I honestly would have worked there longer if I hadn't moved back home in order to take care of some things.
cons: The only real downside I can think of is if you end up working during finals week in the computer labs. One has to be very careful not to end up harmed(long story).

job_title: Assistant Director of Student Engagement in Hammond, LA
pros: Easy to get work experience in multiple function areas, good pay, good volunteer opportunities, great benefits, good leave, great students
cons: micromanagement, hire a lot of under qualified individuals, prefers to hire from within, low quality of work life balance, professional development in nation organizations not encouraged, new ideas are only accepted from upper leadership

review_title: I had an excellent experience as a graduate assistant at Southeastern
pros: My coworkers were truly amazing. We worked well together, accomplished our tasks, and had fun (appropriately) while working!
cons: I honestly don't have many negative things to say about my experience working at Southeastern. I think the parking situation could possibly be better, and I think they could offer better benefits to student employees, but that would probably be the only downfalls I can think of.

review_title: Great if you like working for academia
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Norcross, GA
pros: Access to professors with doctorate degrees in the research I was doing. Schedule flexibility to work on school work as well as research projects. Very interesting environment.
cons: Very unhelpful co-workers (other graduate students), pretty unhelpful staff at times, the parking was outrageously crowded and overtaken. The university values faculty parking more than student parking even though students work for the university at times (like I was).

pros: Paid my tuition, my boss was very nice and laid back, there was some down time and staff was willing to help you grow
cons: Very disorganized, too much red tape, not enough communication with other departments, sometimes they used our budget in other departments and salary was not that high

pros: Students are engaging, respectful, and generally focused.
cons: Because of budget cuts, employees fear for job security and there is extensive backbiting and gossip.  Few avenues for advancement and salaries have been frozen since 2006.

review_title: Directed academic support program for student athletes
pros: Great staff in athletics, great President of University. Dedication to student success and diversity are key points of university mission. Great academic facilities for student athletes.
cons: Budget cuts have had an adverse impact on academic support for student-athletes. Staff layoffs and furloughs have effected staff  morale. Professional development has been reduced.

pros: As a student worker, I have had the privilege to work with some great people that are veterans of the field of study that I am pursuing. Despite my job title and specifications, I have had the opportunity to work on a number of job assignments that have given me the opportunity to expand my repertoire of work experience.
cons: Need more hours though.

pros: The best reasons to work at Southeastern Louisiana University is because of job security.
cons: The worst reason to work at Southeastern Louisiana University is because of there is no ability to move up.

pros: Lots of free time while you're at work? A paycheck? Everyone is in a budget, so it's not like they can't pay you or will cut hours- for the semester or year at least.
cons: Lack of flexibility, separation from upper management. No reward systems for performance, but that's because it's a state school, you know?

pros: Amazing benefits & wonderful work environment! You are able to have a work/life balance with the holidays, school closures and PTO days. Highly recommend working here!!
cons: It is hard to get salary raises, due to state budget cuts. Overall, there are no problems or concerns with working here.

pros: Friendly faculty and staff.  Proxemity to both New Orleans and Baton Rouge.
cons: Presently having financial difficulties due to shortage of funding by state government.  Many of staff are being dismissed or retired early due to funding.

review_title: My career was short-lived with below-average professional pay!
